intro: Couepia multiflora, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a rough texture. Couepia multiflora is often found in humid, tropical environments and can grow as a shrub or small tree.
